result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:34 AM - case called.  Defendant Ty Allen Hanson in court, in custody.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Polzin regarding victim rights.  Court addresses Defendant regarding counsel.  Response by Defendant - will be retaining Atty Laufenberg.  Court addresses speedy trial demand.  Statement by Atty Polzin regarding State's request for an adjournment of the speedy trial.  State further requests the bond be converted to a zero dollar signature bond per statute.  Court addresses Defendant.  Response by Defendant - request to modify the bond conditions.  Response by Atty Polzin regarding no contact condition of bond.  Response by Defendant.  Statement by the Court.  Court grants adjournment of the trial.  Court converts the cash bond to a signature bond and further modifies the conditions of bond.  Court addresses motions filed by the Defendant.  Response by Defendant.  Response by Atty Polzin.  Discussions regarding bond conditions not mirroring the co-defendants.  Statement by the Court - any motions can be scheduled once counsel has been retained.
Scheduling conference scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.
